item.title: Bridge is extremely slippy when on foot and on horseback. There are large holes in the ground leading onto and off of this bridge, 17th February
item.description:
The What3words location for this bridge is ///herbs.ranges.hammer The What3words location for the other two bridges on this bridlepath are ///grapes.sushi.valve ///play.types.flows All 3 bridges are dangerous on horseback with large holes on the edges enough to get a leg stuck in. They are extremely slippery and I’ve had a horse fall because of this. Need some sort of grippy surface being added to the wood to combat this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Quat Goose Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Completely overgrown bridleway impassable to horse riders. Two of us got stuck down here with two horses unable to turn around or continue, 17th February
item.description:
What3words location is ///irrigated.leave.seatbelt This issue has been present for a few years, there was an unofficial path running alongside this bridleway which has now been gated off forcing the use of the bridleway only which is now completely impassable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive disintegration, 17th February

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Two Potholes deeper than tennis balls on Gambles Lane, 17th February
item.description:
W3W mops.user.remission Due to Gambles Lane being used as an unofficial diversion for the closure of New Road the condition is getting worse. As previously stated it is very narrow with few passing places. These two potholes are in the narrowest part of Gambles Lane. This evening we helped yet another vehicle with a punctured tyre who had to use our drive as a place to be rescued by a towing truck. This follows on from our own damaged vehicle (broken suspension, punctured tyre, buckled wheel). Our previous complaint about these potholes has been closed and we have been notified they will be filled within the next 28 days. As these potholes are full of water they are very difficult to gauge their depth. It seems the diversion will be carrying on until at least the end of February so the problems on Gambles need to be rectified now. We are experiencing at least 5 times the normal traffic (delivery vans, builders trucks, heavy lorries etc etc). The residents on Gambles are experiencing drive, wall and property damage which is unsustainable. Please help !!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste outside property worsening vermin issue, 17th February
item.description:
The removal of a large hedge by the council adjacent to Number 6 Aysgarth Avenue, GL51 3RE has led to a vermin issue. The residents of No. 6 dump rubbish outside their property routinely and this is worsening vermin issue. The photos of current waste are much better than previous weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Aysgarth Avenue, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
